records.title: Asymmetric cell divisions and cell fate specification in C. elegans
records.relevance: Canonical review of molecular mechanisms governing asymmetric divisions and fate specification in early embryo

excerpts.text: PAR proteins establish anterior-posterior polarity through cortical flows that segregate P granules to the posterior, ensuring germ-line fate is restricted to the P1 lineage

records.verification_notes: Peer-reviewed Annual Review article by Rose & Gonczy (2014)

records.title: WormBase Cell Lineage Database
records.relevance: Complete cell lineage for all 959 somatic cells, essential for validating cell fate predictions

excerpts.text: The invariant cell lineage of C. elegans produces exactly 959 somatic cells through precisely timed asymmetric divisions

records.title: Wnt signaling polarizes an early C. elegans blastomere
records.relevance: Key paper showing MOM-2/Wnt signal from P2 polarizes EMS blastomere, demonstrating extrinsic fate determination

excerpts.text: MOM-2/Wnt signaling from P2 to EMS is required for proper specification of the E (gut) lineage, with loss of function resulting in transformation of E to MS fate
